InformationEntity.description: InformationEntities are abstract (non-physical) entities that are about something (i.e. they carry  information about things in the real world).

Statement.description: A Statement (aka ‘Assertion’) represents a claim of purported truth as made by a particular agent,  on a particular occasion.

VariationPathogenicityStatement.description: A Statement describing the pathogenicity of a variation.

_id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is  unique within a given system. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different  system.

confidence_level.description: A qualitative term describing the degree of confidence held by the creator of the information entity,  that the information it represents is true.

confidence_score.description: A quantitative score reflecting the degree of confidence held by the creator of the information  entity, that the information it represents is true.

target_proposition.description: The Proposition about which the Statement is made.

conclusion.description: The conclusion drawn from the statement proposition, significance, confidence level, and/or  confidence score.

significance.description: The significance of this statement with respect to the target proposition.

classification.description: The conclusion drawn from the statement proposition, significance, confidence level, and/or  confidence score.

Proposition.description: An abstract ValueEntity representing the shareable meaning that can be  put forth as true in a Statement.
